  • Method Details

    • insert

      public static int insert(String customer_name, String address, String postal_code, String phone, LocalDate create_date, String created_by, Timestamp last_update, String last_updated_by, int division_id) throws SQLException
      Inserts a new customer record into the database.
      Parameters:
      customer_name - The name of the customer.
      address - The address of the customer.
      postal_code - The postal code of the customer.
      phone - The phone number of the customer.
      create_date - The date the customer record was created.
      created_by - The name of the user who created the customer record.
      last_update - The timestamp when the customer record was last updated.
      last_updated_by - The name of the user who last updated the customer record.
      division_id - The ID of the division associated with the customer.
      Returns:
      The number of rows affected by the INSERT statement.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while executing the SQL statement.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the division_id provided does not exist in the database.

    • update

      public static int update(int customer_id, String customer_name, String address, String postal_code, String phone, LocalDate create_date, String created_by, Timestamp last_update, String last_updated_by, int division_id) throws SQLException
      Updates the customer information in the database.
      Parameters:
      customer_id - the ID of the customer to update
      customer_name - the updated name of the customer
      address - the updated address of the customer
      postal_code - the updated postal code of the customer
      phone - the updated phone number of the customer
      create_date - the updated date when the customer was created
      created_by - the updated name of the user who created the customer
      last_update - the updated timestamp when the customer was last updated
      last_updated_by - the updated name of the user who last updated the customer
      division_id - the updated ID of the division where the customer belongs to
      Returns:
      the number of rows affected by the update operation
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified division ID does not exist in the database

    • delete

      public static int delete(int customer_id) throws SQLException
      Deletes a customer and all of their associated appointments from the database.
      Parameters:
      customer_id - the ID of the customer to be deleted
      Returns:
      the total number of rows affected (appointments + customer)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs

    • select

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customers> select() throws SQLException
      Selects all customers from the database and returns an ObservableList of Customers.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of Customers containing all customers in the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL statement.

    • select

      public static Customers select(int customer_id) throws SQLException
      Retrieves a customer from the database with the given ID.
      Parameters:
      customer_id - the ID of the customer to retrieve
      Returns:
      the customer with the given ID, or null if no customer was found with that ID
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error accessing the database

    • selectByMonthAndYear

      public static int selectByMonthAndYear(String month, Integer year) throws SQLException
      Returns the count of customers created in the specified month and year.
      Parameters:
      month - the month to filter by (in the format "January", "February", etc.)
      year - the year to filter by (e.g. 2021)
      Returns:
      the count of customers created in the specified month and year
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • getCustomerNames

      public static HashMap<Integer,String> getCustomerNames() throws SQLException
      Retrieves a mapping of customer IDs to customer names for all customers in the database.
      Returns:
      a HashMap containing customer IDs as keys and customer names as values.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
